snippet: The federal government paid $11.3 million to 50 billionaires or businesses they own over a 17-year period, the Environmental Working Group says.
abstract: Report released by research organization Environmental Working Group finds that from 1995 to 2012, federal government paid $11.3 million in taxpayer-funded farm subsidies to 50 billionaires or businesses in which they have some form of ownership.
lead_paragraph: The federal government paid $11.3 million to 50 billionaires or businesses they own over a 17-year period, the Environmental Working Group says.

headline.main: Billionaires Received U.S. Farm Subsidies, Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Billionaires Received U.S. Farm Subsidies, Report Finds
